title: Voluntary recognitions, April 1, 2023 - June 30, 2023

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Voluntary recognitions, April 1, 2023 - June 30, 2023
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Please provide  records sufficient to determine the number of voluntary employee union recognitions from  April 1, 2023 through June 30, 2023. If available, please provide records about individual recognition with such fields as employer, location, description of bargaining unit, union, and size of unit, and any other non-exempt fields on Form NLRB-5581.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Forest Gregg

title: Pittsburgh Pirates/MLB and city government correspondence regarding air quality

communications.subject: Pennsylvania Right to Know Act Request: Pittsburgh Pirates/MLB and city government correspondence regarding air quality
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Pennsylvania Right to Know Act, I hereby request the following records:

1)All external correspondence regarding air quality, including email, phone, fax, or video (i.e., Google Meet/Hangouts, Zoom, etc.) between the Pittsburgh Pirates and the City of Pittsburgh Mayor's Office.
2) All external correspondence regarding air quality, including email, phone, fax, or video, between Major League Baseball (MLB) and the City of Pittsburgh Mayor's Office .
3) All external correspondence regarding air quality, including email, phone, fax, or video, between the Major League Baseball Player's Association (MLBPA) and the City of Pittsburgh Mayor's Office.
4) All internal correspondence (including email, phone, fax, or video) regarding the Pittsburgh Pirates, MLB, and MLBPA.

Between the dates 06/26/2023 and the date this request is received.

If you determine that any information qualifies for an exemption from disclosure, I ask you to note whether the exemption is discretionary and, if so, whether it is necessary in this case to exercise your discretion to withhold the information.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge and processed by a representative of the news media/press and is made in the process of news gathering and not for commercial usage.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I also ask that our request be filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available (email: holler@bwd.nyc) – if not, secure file transfer, thumb drive, or CD-ROM. I am also available via phone at 718.360.6359 to discuss any questions you have about the request.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Bradford William Davis

title: Board + Leadership Personnel Files

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: Board + Leadership Personnel Files
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

Please supply the full personnel files of the following individuals:

*Jianan Shi, former teacher at Solorio Academy
*Stacy Davis Gates, previous CPS teacher, current CTU president
*Kaitlyn Girard, current Chief of Labor Relations
*Camie Pratt, current Chief Title IX Officer

This includes any resumes, applications, any job recommendations, promotions, professional license credentials and verification records. Please include a work/salary history. Please include any investigative materials - investigative memorandums, disciplinary actions (suspensions, leaves of absence that stem from disciplinary action), incident reports, EOCO investigations, Office of Civil Rights determinations, non-disciplinary memorandum of understandings, non-union misconduct form, full warning resolutions and any complaints or claims/lawsuits/settlements. Please include any safety plans. Please include any separation agreements and any other disclosure agreements.

Because this request is in the public interest for Illinois nonprofit The FOIA Bakery’s work to advocate for public education, please waive any fees in accordance with 5 ILCS § 140/6(c). Feel free to contact me with any questions, or if clarification is needed.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Miriam Bhimani

communications.subject: Non-Commercial FOIA Request :: N013892-070423
communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line --- 

07/05/2023 

Miriam Bhimani 
MuckRock News, DEPT MR148621 263 Huntington Ave 
Boston MA 02115 

Dear Miriam: 

RE: Chicago Public Schools FOIA Request N013892-070423 
Thank you again for using the Chicago Public Schools FOIA Center. 
Under the Freedom of Information Act, a public body may extend the time to respond to a FOIA request by up to 5 business days for a limited number of reasons. 5 ILCS 140/3(e). 
We are extending the time to respond to your request by 5 business days for one or more of the following reason(s): 
(  ) the requested records are stored in whole or in part at other locations than the office having charge of the requested records; 
( )  the request requires the collection of a substantial number of specified records; 
( ) the request is couched in categorical terms and requires an extensive search for the records responsive to it; 
( ) the requested records have not been located in the course of routine search and additional efforts are being made to locate them; 
(x) the requested records require examination and evaluation by personnel having the necessary competence and discretion to determine if they are exempt from disclosure under Section 7 of this Act or should be revealed only with appropriate deletions; 
(x) the request for records cannot be complied with by the public body within the time limits prescribed by 5 ILCS 140/3 (c) without unduly burdening or interfering with the operations of the public body; 
() there is need for consultation, which shall be conducted with all practicable speed, with another public body or among two or more components of a public body having a substantial interest in the determination or in the subject matter of the request. 

Sincerely, 

Patricia Majchrowicz 
FOIA Officer 
Chicago Public Schools 
Please note that District Offices were closed on Tuesday, July 4th in observance of Independance Day.

title: FPS2

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: FPS2
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

According to the the CMS Website, in 2011, the Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services (“CMS”) developed and implemented the Fraud Prevention System (“FPS”), now FPS2, to implement predictive analytics technologies to identify and prevent the payment of fraudulent claims in the Medicare Fee-for-Service Program. The FPS 2 develops models to identify fraud waste and abuse and monitor the models to validate effective alerting.

I am seeking:

1) Contracts, memorandums of understanding, and statements of work between the department and any outside party regarding the implementation and development of FPS2 of any service to detect or predict fraud

2) Documentation of FPS 2 or predictive models that the agency currently uses (including those used as aids to human decision making). This documentation should include, where available: executive summaries of the algorithm/model's purpose, lists of the data sources, breakdowns of how the model weights various input data, descriptions of the statistical or machine learning techniques employed, the results of validation and accuracy testing, disparate impact studies, and algorithmic impact reports.

3) A data dictionary/library for each predictive or detection model or algorithm identified in response to items 1 and 2 of this requests.

4) Copies of any internal or independent audits of the identified models or algorithms.

5) Aggregate or disaggregated data, if any exists, breaking down the risk scores or outputs of the fraud model.

6) Training data code and model files for the above algorithms.

As required under FOIA, I request that the agency provide the above records in their native digital format, where applicable (such as a CSV, Excel, or other digital data format), and transferred to me electronically.

News media status and fee waiver:

As a reporter for WIRED, I qualify as a news media requester for the purpose of fees. See 5 U.S.C. 552(a)(4)(A)(ii). Further, because this request is being made for a journalistic purpose regarding a matter of public interest, I further ask that you waive any fees. See 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(4)(A)(iii). Disclosure of information regarding the use of predictive analytics will contribute significantly to public understanding of how CMS uses advanced machine learning technology. This request is not primarily in the commercial interest of myself or WIRED.

Additionally, please notify me of costs before taking any billable steps.

Segregability:

If you deny this request in whole or in part, I request that you respond with the statutory
exemption underlying the denial and the reasoning therein. If an asserted exemption applies to
only a portion of a record, please delete or redact the portion to which the exemption applies and
provide the remainder of the record, as required under the FOIA.

If you have any questions about my request, please do not hesitate to e-mail me or call
me. Conde Nast's legal counsel is also copied on this letter. We look forward to a response as quickly as possible under the provisions of the Freedom of Information
Act (5 U.S.C. Section 552).

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Dhruv Mehrotra

title: FBI file: Brigid Berlin

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: FBI file: Brigid Berlin
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

A copy of FBI files on Brigid Berlin, a New York artist and socialite whose death was widely reported in the media in July 2020. Here is one example: https://www.nytimes.com/2020/07/18/arts/brigid-berlin-dead.html

According to news reports, she was born Brigid Emmett Berlin in Manhattan on Sept. 6, 1939. I request that you use those details to augment your search.

I request that your agency conduct a full CRS search, as well as a cross reference search, to retrieve records related to this prominent American.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Ben Welsh

title: SS Activation (NYPD 49th Precinct)

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: SS Activation (NYPD 49th Precinct)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

On Friday, June 30, 2023 at around 1:13AM there was a report of a gunshot at Paulding Ave & Mace Ave, Bronx, New York, 10469 due to a shot spotter activation.  According to dispatch radio, NYPD officers of the 47th or 49th precincts responded and made contact with multiple witnesses who stated they heard fireworks in the area. I am looking for body camera footage and incident reports for this incident.  

If possible, to identify these records, look for any records for police responding to an incident of reported gunfire from the evening of June 29th 2023 to June 30 2023 before 7 AM near Paulding Ave and Mace Ave in the Bronx. A possible address is 2549 Colden Ave.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Dhruv Mehrotra

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. All internal emails from the year 2010 to the present, pertaining to changes made to television set and radio equipment in all relevant units of the Administrative Maximum Facility (ADMAX) within the United States Penitentiary (USP) Florence complex.

title: Communications Regarding Vote Changes in the New York State Senate

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Communications Regarding Vote Changes in the New York State Senate
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

Given recent reports in the Buffalo News regarding instances of retroactively altered votes in the New York State Senate, I am seeking access to the following records:

1. Any and all written communications, including but not limited to emails, memos, and text messages, among Senate members, their staff, and any other relevant parties, regarding the alteration of votes on the bill allowing Gov. Kathy Hochul to enter a new gaming compact with the Seneca Nation and the bill rolling back a major campaign finance reform law. This should cover the period from June 1, 2023, to the present.

2. Any and all instructions or guidelines provided to Senate members or their staff regarding the process or possibility of altering votes after they have been cast. This should cover the period from January 1, 2023, to the present.

3. Any and all records of requests made by Senate members to alter their votes after they have been cast, including the reasons provided for such requests. This should cover the period from January 1, 2023, to the present.

I understand that there may be fees associated with the processing of this request. Please inform me of any such fees before processing the request.

If any part of this request is denied, please cite the specific exemption you believe justifies your refusal to release the information and inform me of your agency's appeal procedures.

Thank you for your attention to this matter.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jackson Parker

title: FOIA Devereaux Knox Vietnam War  ST-2

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: FOIA Devereaux Knox Vietnam War  ST-2
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

OMPF for Devereaux Knox including cumulative record of training, history of assignments, military education, transfers and receipts, all military decorations and citations, personnel evaluations, unit awards, deployments South Vietnam.
1) History of Assignments NAVPERS form 601-5
2) Navy Occupational training history NAVPERS 601-4
3) Cumulative transfers and receipts NAVPERS 601-12, administrative remarks
4) Bronze Star Medal award citations, Navy Commendation Medal citations
Retired Master Chief MMCM, retired 1988. Awards include Bronze Star Medal with Combat V, Navy Commendation Medal, Combat Action Ribbon, good conduct medal, Presidential Unit Citation, Navy Unit Commendation, Vietnam Service Medal. Service with ST-2 SEAL TEAM TWO  Vietnam Conflict 1967 to 1969, UDT-21. Training includes Underwater Demolition Team Replacement UDTR training, Basic Airborne School, SERE, 5321 UDT Swimmer, 5326 Navy SEAL.
Passed away Thursday, May 20, 2010.

Please redact any sensitive information protected in accordance with the Privacy Act of 1974.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Eric Bradley

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

1. Any documents pertaining to any Florida Attorney General Investigation into the internet platforms  Ebay or Paypal for discriminating against certain Florida residents because of their politics and blocking access to these platforms. Don Stone

title: Any Florida Attorney General Documents that would Identify Any State Of Florida Agencies Required By Law To Investigate Organized Crime in Florida.

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Any Florida Attorney General Documents that would Identify Any State Of Florida Agencies Required By Law To Investigate Organized Crime in Florida.
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

1. Any Florida Attorney General (hereafter FLAG) documents that would identify any State of Florida entities required by law to investigate the alleged operation of organized crime syndicates or white collar organized crime syndicates operating in Florida, targeting Florida residents.
2. Any FLAG documents used to define (definition for) the phrase "organized crime" in the State of Florida.
3. Any FLAG documents used to define (definition for) the phrase " white color organized crime" in the State of Florida.
4. A copy of any FL AG policy/protocol for representing non-Florida politicians in federal court, who have alleged ties to organized crime.
5. A copy of any FLAG policy/protocol for representing non-Florida politicians in federal court, who are involved in alleged "Fraud on the Court" schemes.
  (Definition for Fraud on the Court)The requisite fraud on the court occurs where “it can be demonstrated, clearly and convincingly, that a party has sentiently set in motion some unconscionable scheme calculated to interfere with the judicial system’s ability impartially to adjudicate a matter by improperly influencing the trier of fact or unfairly hampering the presentation of the opposing party’s claim or defense.” Aoude v. Mobil Oil Corp., 892 F.2d 1115, 1118 (1st Cir. 1989). . . .:
6. Any FLAG documents that would exempt Lawyers employed by FLAG office from compliance with Florida Bar, Rules of Professional Conduct https://www-media.floridabar.org/uploads/2023/06/Ch-4.pdf
6. Any documents of the vetting of Robert Butterworth, for FLAG.
7. Any documents of the FLAG for the vetting of Scott Masel for head of Florida Attorney General office CIVIL Division, Ft. Lauderdale.
8. Any documents of the FLAG for the vetting of the female (Scott Masel's counterpart) for head of Florida Attorney General office CRIMINAL Division, Ft. Lauderdale.
9. Any FLAG documents on a Richard McCleary drug trafficking operation out of Florida, Vero Beach or Key West,Florida to Maryland, Ocean City or Salisbury)
10. Any FLAG investigation into Florida Dept. of Law Enforcement employees, Michael Ramage, David Sessions, Tim Elder, or Michael Washam.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Don Stone

title: Communications with Gov.'s Office over Budget cut and CEO change at Georgia Public Broadcasting

communications.subject: Georgia Open Records Act Request: Communications with Gov.'s Office over Budget cut and CEO change at Georgia Public Broadcasting
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Georgia Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Emails, text messages and other communications regarding budget cuts, layoffs, programming changes, and the executive director retirement, interim appointment, and permanent replacement search at Georgia Public Broadcasting from April 1, 2023 to the present. 

This would include any communications between the Office of Gov. and members of the Georgia Public Telecommunications Commission (Brian Dill, Jerald Mitchell, Cecil Staton), executives at GPB (gpb.org) including Teya Rayn, Bert Wesley Huffman, Elizabeth Laprade, Bill Nigut, and employees of the Atlanta Journal-Constitution (employees possessing email addresses that end in @ajc.com), Cox Media Group (@cmg.com or @coxmediagroup.com), and Cox Enterprises (@coxinc.com, @cox.com, and @coxenterprises.com).

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brian Patrick Bannon

title: Tos Violation

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Tos Violation
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Expedited handling requested

I was seeking a copy of the annual code of conduct affirmation that is signed by each EOUSA or USAO employee to comply with the standards of conduct outlaid by the Department of Justice including but not limited to: 1-4.200 - Allegations of Misconduct by Department of Justice Employees—General Considerations etc.

Justification for expedited handling:  By EOUSA FOIA volition a pattern of requests has been overturned by the DOJ OIP, this casts a reasonable doubt in relation to morale with the EOUSA and its ethics in handling FOIA/PA on behalf of the United States and its management of the FOIA/PA or lack thereof.  I wish to urgently educate the public about the operations of EOUSA and ensure that any young person who would endeavor to pursue a career in civil service be aware of the guidelines for performance that it includes.  

Fee Waiver:
Not requested.  This document should be a common document in every EOUSA personnel file. I do not think the search should exceed the free time allowed.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

William Fernandes

title: Leadership Personnel Files

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: Leadership Personnel Files
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

Please supply the full personnel files of the following individuals:

*Bogdana Chkoumbova, current Chief Education Officer
*Stephanie Jones, previous Chief of ODLSS
*Jorge Macias, current Chief of Language and Cultural Education
*Adrian Segura, current Chief of FACE

This includes any resumes, applications, any job recommendations, promotions, professional license credentials and verification records. Please include a work/salary history. Please include any investigative materials - investigative memorandums, disciplinary actions (suspensions, leaves of absence that stem from disciplinary action), incident reports, EOCO investigations, Office of Civil Rights determinations, non-disciplinary memorandum of understandings, non-union misconduct form, full warning resolutions and any complaints or claims/lawsuits/settlements. Please include any safety plans. Please include any separation agreements and any other disclosure agreements.

Because this request is in the public interest for Illinois nonprofit The FOIA Bakery’s work to advocate for public education, please waive any fees in accordance with 5 ILCS § 140/6(c). Feel free to contact me with any questions, or if clarification is needed.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Miriam Bhimani

Upon the completion of a response, CPS will provide the first 50 pages to you at no charge.  If a response is more than 50 pages, a fee of 15¢ per page will be charged for each additional page. communications.subject: Non-Commercial FOIA Request :: N013889-070223
communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line --- 

07/05/2023 

Miriam Bhimani 
MuckRock News, DEPT MR148517 263 Huntington Ave 
Boston MA 02115 

Dear Miriam: 

RE: Chicago Public Schools FOIA Request N013889-070223 
Thank you again for using the Chicago Public Schools FOIA Center. 
Under the Freedom of Information Act, a public body may extend the time to respond to a FOIA request by up to 5 business days for a limited number of reasons. 5 ILCS 140/3(e). 
We are extending the time to respond to your request by 5 business days for one or more of the following reason(s): 
(  ) the requested records are stored in whole or in part at other locations than the office having charge of the requested records; 
( )  the request requires the collection of a substantial number of specified records; 
( ) the request is couched in categorical terms and requires an extensive search for the records responsive to it; 
( ) the requested records have not been located in the course of routine search and additional efforts are being made to locate them; 
(x) the requested records require examination and evaluation by personnel having the necessary competence and discretion to determine if they are exempt from disclosure under Section 7 of this Act or should be revealed only with appropriate deletions; 
(x) the request for records cannot be complied with by the public body within the time limits prescribed by 5 ILCS 140/3 (c) without unduly burdening or interfering with the operations of the public body; 
() there is need for consultation, which shall be conducted with all practicable speed, with another public body or among two or more components of a public body having a substantial interest in the determination or in the subject matter of the request. 

Sincerely, 

Patricia Majchrowicz 
FOIA Officer 
Chicago Public Schools 
Please note that District Offices were closed on Tuesday, July 4th in observance of Independance Day.

communications.subject: RE: Maine Freedom of Access Act Request: Records Retention Schedules, Org Charts, Employee Chart, Master List of Forms, FOAA Log
communications.communication:
Hi Corey,

Please let this email act as acknowledgement of your request. Can you please clarify what you mean by “Master List of Forms”? Additionally, when you ask for “salary list”, are you requesting an individual’s current annual salary?


Thank you,

Lindsey Chasteen, MBA
Office Administrator
Office of Chief Medical Examiner
37 SHS
Augusta, Maine  04333
Phone (207) 624-7180
Fax (207) 624-7178


CONFIDENTIALITY NOTICE:
This e-mail message, including any attachments, is for the sole use of the intended recipient(s) and may contain confidential and privileged information. Any unauthorized review, use, disclosure or distribution is prohibited. If you are not the intended recipient, please contact the sender by reply e-mail and destroy all copies of the original message.

communications.subject: RE: Maine Freedom of Access Act Request: Records Retention Schedules, Org Charts, Employee Chart, Master List of Forms, FOAA Log
communications.communication:
Hi Lindsey,

Certainly , what I meant by “master list of forms” is a full list of forms that OCME would use, what that form is named, if it has a form number.

An example of this would be (from my days on the army)DA form 4856-E : developmental counseling form

It would basically be a list of all forms.

For the employee list, yes if possible could you also include current annual salary.

Please let me know if you have any more questions or if I could clarify my request any further to help aid with the speedy processing of this request!

Thanks,
Corey Bouchard
